body_html: @apaszke to clarify: I am indeed implementing pdfs, the issue is that some of them require mathematical functions not available in PyTorch. For example the gamma distribution pdf requires the gamma math function, and the Beta and Dirichlet distribution pdfs require the beta math function. In practice, for stability reasons, it's best to work with log-pdfs (which would require the log-gamma and log-beta math functions). As the models I am working with are quite complex CUDA acceleration is required in order to train them.

body: @apaszke to clarify: I am indeed implementing pdfs, the issue is that some of them require mathematical functions not available in PyTorch. For example the [gamma distribution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gamma_distribution) pdf requires the [gamma math function](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gamma_function), and the Beta and Dirichlet distribution pdfs require the beta math function. In practice, for stability reasons, it's best to work with log-pdfs (which would require the log-gamma and log-beta math functions). As the models I am working with are quite complex CUDA acceleration is required in order to train them.
